channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: ‚ÄúA thing is right when it tends to preserve the integrity, stability and beauty of the biotic community. It is wrong when it tends otherwise.‚Äù ‚ÄîAldo Leopold
There should be a week-long unit in school each year about the difference between living well and merely going through the motions. https://t.co/mbMrgBD3wU
Assault rifles in U.S. daily life: "We will continue to live with them because they are a near-perfect companion to minority rule." https://t.co/YDMUTEicBX

IN-2nd's @RepWalorski / @JackieWalorski seems not to have heard about the Jan 6 hearings, or maybe she can't think of anything useful to say, or more likely she's part of the GOP plan to distract Americans from the shameful findings.

The January 6th committee: Nowhere near aggressive enough about social media when facing a Republican party that routinely throws up smoke screens on anything related to truth and fact. https://t.co/CP6g3kPKqc
‚ÄúIs there anyone in Trump World who isn't trying [to] fleece the Deplorables?‚Äù ‚ÄîAnn Coulter
@herdyshepherd1 We need a sort of Whole Earth Catalog of methods and methods and methods.
‚ÄúIf a complaint can leave a trail as well as be a tale, a complaint can be how we know where to go to find each other.‚Äù https://t.co/zkRvVEjLJf
@herdyshepherd1 Moving them Missouri-style!
If something I owned and cared about had lost 2/3 of its value since I pushed back from dinner last Thanksgiving, I'd be freaking out. Cryptocurrency Global Charts. https://t.co/TpHy7f4Zos
I wonder if Einstein overstated the case here . . . https://t.co/dStOnyPUOc
‚ÄúNone of these men who worked for Trump opened their mouths at the time.‚Äù https://t.co/sMdNy3yV8f
Wordle 360 2/6 üü®üü®üü®üü®üü® üü©üü©üü©üü©üü© Well, that was different‚Ä¶
@JordanDavisPoet I am most fond of number 4.

Writers often use commonplace books to record quotations that they may want to come back to someday and build on. For writers who don't have much of an audience on Twitter, Twitter itself acts like an easy-to-write-in but not-easy-to-read-later commonplace book. So, not so good.
"Little lands on the borders of a great empire were always hateful to the lords of the great empire." https://t.co/IZ8OhW99qw

‚ÄúMost of her friends, who seemed to her ordinarily hard-working, anxious, and hopeful, people, could lay claim to being disowned or prayed for, in some disappointed home. ‚ÄîAlice Munro, ‚ÄúSpelling‚Äù #SundaySentence @MunroQuotes
The democratic possibilities of web publishing? In 2003, Christopher Lydon (@RadioOpenSource) and @DaveWiner put down some markers on the topic in this republished audio. https://t.co/g6qBwtD6DC

‚ÄúTo remember a battle in which he has taken part,‚Äù [Louis Simpson] wrote in 1964, ‚Äúa man must make himself innocent again ‚Äî innocent of newspapers, books and movies. He must remember his actual life, the life of the body. Everything else is journalism.‚Äù https://t.co/RkgHPQsB5o

The @January6thCmte showed on Thursday that public discourse is a damned serious matter, far more serious than many politicians and journalists understand. And @FoxNews confirmed that their goal is not truth but victory to be won through the arts of deception and distraction. https://t.co/v4jAcEz9n3
Image: Initial D: The Fool with Two Demons (detail) in a psalter, illuminations by the Master of the Ingeborg Psalter, after 1205. The J. Paul Getty Museum, Ms. 66, fol. 56. Via Elisabeth Morrison.

The @January6thCmte showed that public discourse is a damned serious matter, far more serious than many politicians and journalists understand. @FoxNews confirmed on Thursday that their goal is not truth but victory to be achieved through the arts of deception and distraction.
Dead cities, the reporter said. (A poem from this week's news.) https://t.co/hXoqc2VM37
Judging by the Fox response, we are a society that subsists on cartoons. We could hardly be in deeper trouble than that. https://t.co/rCGxycFNlO
The story of maturity is a long story, if we're lucky. https://t.co/F8fPVhSTCx
Last night: Fox ‚Äúnews‚Äù people rebutting a report they hadn‚Äôt seen yet as it was being broadcast live on the other channels. https://t.co/0fIFFAGbqz
